abstract: As they vet potential candidates, Lawrence H. Summers, director of the National Economic Council, and Timothy F. Geithner, the Treasury secretary, are balancing their own desires with political pressures from within and outside the White House.
snippet: As they vet potential candidates, Lawrence H. Summers, director of the National Economic Council, and Timothy F. Geithner, the Treasury secretary, are balancing their own desires with political pressures from within and outside the White House.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — To fill three seats on the Federal Reserve’s board of governors, the Obama administration is balancing seemingly contrary needs.

headline.main: Juggling Act for Obama in Filling Fed Board Openings
headline.print_headline: Juggling Act In Filling Seats at Fed

abstract: To fill three seats on the Federal Reserve’s board of governors, the Obama administration is balancing seemingly contrary needs.
snippet: To fill three seats on the Federal Reserve’s board of governors, the Obama administration is balancing seemingly contrary needs.
lead_paragraph: To fill three seats on the Federal Reserve‘s board of governors, the Obama administration is balancing seemingly contrary needs, Sewell Chan reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Juggling Act to Fill Fed Board Openings

abstract: LyondellBasell Industries says it rejected a takeover bid by Reliance Industries because it has a superior reorganization plan that would leave the chemical maker valued at about $15.2 billion.
snippet: LyondellBasell Industries says it rejected a takeover bid by Reliance Industries because it has a superior reorganization plan that would leave the chemical maker valued at about $15.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: LyondellBasell Industries says it rejected a takeover bid by Reliance Industries because it has a superior reorganization plan that would leave the chemical maker valued at about $15.2 billion, Bloomberg News reports.

headline.main: Lyondell Says Its Plan Is Better Than Reliance Bid
